description: Master the art of gliding through evolving narrow corridors in this physics-based flight skill game.
rationale: This game focuses on delicate physics management and spatial awareness. It targets casual gamers looking for a 'easy to learn, hard to master' experience and provides an excellent environment for AI agents to learn continuous control and predictive pathfinding.
details: The player controls a paper plane that constantly moves forward (left to right). The game uses a simple physics model where gravity pulls the plane down, and 'lifting' (pressing a key) pushes it up, but consumes momentum. The environment consists of procedurally generated caves or corridors with varying heights. Touching the ceiling or floor results in a game over. The goal is to survive as long as possible while collecting air currents (score multipliers). Unlike 'Flappy Bird', the movement is smoother, mimicking a glide rather than a frantic flap.
how_to_build: uv venv && uv pip install pygame-ce
how_to_play: Objective: Travel the maximum distance without colliding. Controls: Press and hold the SPACE BAR or UP ARROW to apply lift and ascend. Release to glide down under gravity. Scoring: 10 points per second survived, 100 points per 'Air Current' (blue circles) collected. Game ends immediately upon hitting any obstacle or boundary.
